content.description:
Pizza for Breakfast has fun, varied climbing. Start with

Do or Fly

over an initial 5.10 roof before following 5.6 climbing to a good ledge. Pass 4 more bolts over the next 45 feet to a ledge with anchors right and left. Consider a directional piece if heading left to protect your 2nd at the top.

It is possible to rap to ground with a second rope or back to top of either

NYDD

or

DoF

1175929901st pitches with a 70m rope. This makes for great access to TR

Do or Fly

.
content.protection: Yellow C3-0.5 for the 1st pitch. 11 bolts for the 2nd pitch + anchors.

content.description:
Start up slabby climbing past 2 bolts. Find gear starting just before a left-facing dihedral, and continue up until a bolt becomes visible on the right. Clip and step across to the 1st belay ledge. Now you're on the money pitch! From the anchor, head right then up past 2 more bolts to the dihedral above. Place gear making sure to extend as you approach the roof. Step left through the obvious weakness then back right to the anchors.

I recommend a rap here; however, you can follow the path of least resistance to the anchors above to gain the summit.
content.protection: 5 bolts, bolted anchors, and a standard rack from a yellow C3-#2 C4.

content.description:
The first pitch shared with

Not Your Daddyâ€™s Dihedrals

but heads left to anchors at the top of the dihedral. The 2nd pitch heads up through weakness in roof before traversing right and following easier climbing to good ledge. The business of the route starts here through sustained balancy and gently overhanging 5.12 climbing on bulletproof S. Platte granite past 4 bolts before a tough move to top out. Pass one more bolt and head up and right to the anchors.
content.protection: Yellow C3-#0.5 and 2 draws for pitch one and 13 bolts plus anchors for the second pitch.
